title: Word Classification-Based Instructional Design for Vocabulary Development in Low-Income Preschool Children

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Establishment of collaborative and data analysis environments utilizing digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners design a 4-week vocabulary intervention program with 100 target words applying classification strategies (semantic/morphological/syntactic) and achieve ≥3.5 points (5-point scale) in expert review evaluations.

Learners can design instructional methods to enhance vocabulary acquisition and reasoning skills for low-income preschool children (ages 3–5), develop over 10 activity-based lesson materials, and demonstrate a 20% increase in vocabulary size and a 15% improvement in reasoning task accuracy through pre- and post-assessments.

Learners can analyze project-based assessment data (including ≥5 educational effectiveness indicators) over a 6-month long-term course, propose ≥3 improvement strategies with statistically significant results (p<0.05), and produce a final report incorporating peer evaluations and instructor feedback.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
